metadata.title: Neko Master - Network Visualization
metadata.description: Modern traffic analytics for edge gateways

header.title: Neko Master
header.subtitle: Modern traffic analytics for edge gateways

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Real-time traffic monitoring and analytics
dashboard.errorHint: Make sure the backend API service is running and network connection is normal
dashboard.backendUnavailableHint: Data collection is interrupted. Please check backend connectivity.
dashboard.backendUnhealthyDesc: The current backend connection is abnormal, please check the backend status in Settings

trend.title: Traffic Trend
trend.noDataHint: Try switching to a shorter range or wait for new traffic.

topDomains.title: Top Domains
topDomains.noDataHint: Traffic data will appear here after collection starts.

topProxies.noDataHint: Traffic data will appear here after collection starts.

topCountries.noDataHint: Traffic data will appear here after collection starts.

domains.title: Top Domains
domains.noDataHint: Traffic data will appear here after collection starts.

ips.title: Top IP Addresses
ips.noDataHint: Traffic data will appear here after collection starts.

proxies.title: Proxies
proxies.noDataHint: Proxy traffic details will appear after collection starts.

devices.title: Devices
devices.noDataHint: Device traffic details will appear after collection starts.

rules.title: Rules
rules.description: Traffic distribution by matching rules and their final proxy nodes
rules.noDataHint: Rule traffic details will appear after collection starts.

pwa.tooltip: Install as a desktop app for faster access and a native experience

about.title: About
about.description: Modern traffic analytics for edge gateways

auth.loginDescription: Please enter your access token to continue

backend.title: Settings
backend.firstTimeDescription: Enter your gateway connection information to start monitoring traffic
backend.name: Name
backend.tokenPlaceholder: Optional, if set please fill in
backend.agentTokenHint: Use the same token in agent flag --backend-token.
backend.agentModeHint: Agent mode does not connect to LAN directly. Create first, then run neko-agent with backend-id and this token.
backend.agentTokenAutoHint: Backend token is generated automatically after creation and shown once for copy.
backend.agentTokenRequired: Backend token is required in agent mode
backend.agentSetupDescription: Backend #{id} created. Copy the token and startup command below.
backend.agentInstallScriptHint: Optional: set NEKO_GATEWAY_TOKEN before `sh` when your gateway API has auth.
backend.agentTokenPlaceholder: Paste backend-token to generate full scripts
backend.agentTokenInputHint: You can paste backend-token to generate scripts (it is not saved to backend settings).
backend.agentTokenManagedHint: Agent token is system-managed. Use "View Agent Script" to rotate token.
backend.agentTokenUnavailableHint: Historical token is not shown. Click "Rotate Token" to generate a new random token.
backend.agentTokenMissingHint: backend-token is empty, scripts will use the `backend-token` placeholder.
backend.agentTokenGenerateFirstHint: Click "Rotate Token" to generate a new random token before copying full scripts.
backend.agentTokenRotateHint: Rotating token invalidates old agents. Update token and restart the agent.
backend.agentRotateTokenConfirm: Rotate this agent token now? Existing agents using the old token will be disconnected until reconfigured.
backend.agentRotateTokenSuccess: Agent token rotated. Update and restart your agent.
backend.agentTokenLocalOnlyHint: This token input is only used for script generation.
backend.agentQuickAddHint: If nekoagent is already installed, use this command to add the backend directly
backend.agentRunHint: Run agent temporarily without installing (for testing only)
backend.agentGatewayOptionalHint: Optional: fill gateway host / port / token and copied scripts will include them.
backend.agentGatewaySectionHint: These values are included when generating run and install scripts.
backend.agentGatewayTokenPlaceholder: Optional, e.g. Clash secret or Surge x-key
backend.tokenKeepPlaceholder: Token already set, leave blank to keep
backend.deleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this backend configuration? This action cannot be undone.
backend.addBackendHint: Click the button below to add a new backend
backend.clearLogsDescription: Clear old connection logs to free up disk space. This action cannot be undone.
backend.confirmClearLogs: Are you sure you want to clear logs older than {days} days?
backend.confirmClearAllLogs: Are you sure you want to clear ALL logs? This will delete all historical connection records and cannot be undone.
backend.firstBackendAutoActive: First backend automatically set as active
backend.verificationFailed: Backend verification failed. Please check the host address and token.
backend.faviconProviderDescription: Choose the service used to display website icons in the domain list. favicon.im is recommended for users in China.
backend.geoLookupProviderDescription: Switch between online API and local MMDB lookup. Online mode works out of the box, while local mode is suitable for offline or restricted-network environments.
backend.geoLookupFixedPathHint: Local mode automatically reads MMDB files (requires GeoLite2-City.mmdb and GeoLite2-ASN.mmdb, Country optional).
backend.geoLookupLocalUnavailable: Local MMDB is currently unavailable. Missing required files: {files}
backend.geoLookupUpdateFailed: Failed to save IP lookup configuration
backend.dataRetentionDescription: Control how long detailed connection records are kept. Domain and IP statistics are always preserved. Longer storage uses more disk space but allows troubleshooting older issues.
backend.retentionPresetMinimalDesc: Save disk space, keep 3 days of details
backend.retentionPresetExtendedDesc: Full history, keep 30 days of details
backend.retentionPresetMaximumDesc: Maximum retention, keep 90 days of details
backend.retentionCustomDesc: Set your own storage period (max 90 days)
backend.showcaseModeAddDisabled: Adding backends is disabled in showcase mode
backend.showcaseModeSecurityDisabled: Security settings are locked in showcase mode
backend.showcaseModeDbDisabled: Database operations are disabled in showcase mode

auth.title: Access Control
auth.description: Enable access control to protect your dashboard data
auth.tokenRequirements: Token must be at least 6 characters with both letters and numbers
auth.tokenHint: Set a memorable but hard-to-guess token
auth.enabledSuccess: Access control enabled, please remember your token
auth.warningDescription: Please keep your access token safe. If you lose it, you won't be able to access the dashboard.
auth.confirmEnableDescription: After enabling access control, all users will need to enter the correct token to access the dashboard.
auth.rememberTokenWarning: Please remember this token! You won't be able to access the dashboard if you lose it!
auth.confirmEnable: I have remembered the token, confirm enable
auth.confirmDisableDescription: After disabling access control, anyone can access your dashboard. Are you sure?
auth.changeTokenDescription: Update your access token to a new one
auth.forceOffWarningDescription: Authentication is forced off via environment variable. You can reset your password without providing the current one.
auth.emergencyResetDescription: You are currently in Emergency Access Mode. After resetting the token, the old one will be invalid.
auth.emergencyResetWarning: For your security, please remove the backend environment variable FORCE_ACCESS_CONTROL_OFF and restart the service after the reset is complete.
